Detailed Description

Protocol for interacting with an SQL database.

Member Function Documentation

- (BOOL) goodConnection  

Test that the connection is active.

- (BOOL) executeUpdate: (NSString *)  statement
,   ... 

Execute an update, returning YES on success, NO on failure.

Any arguments should be provided following the statement, and referred to using standard '?' JDBC substitutions

Parameters:
statement SQL statement to execute.

- (BOOL) executeUpdateAndReturnError: (NSError **)  error
statement: (NSString *)  statement
,   ... 

Execute an update, returning YES on success, NO on failure.

Any arguments should be provided following the statement, and referred to using standard '?' JDBC substitutions

Parameters:
error A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the statement could not be executed. If no error occurs, this parameter will be left unmodified. You may specify nil for this parameter, and no error information will be provided.
statement SQL statement to execute.

,   ... 

Execute a query, returning a PLResultSet.

Any arguments should be provided following the statement, and referred to using standard '?' JDBC substitutions

Parameters:
error A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the statement could not be executed. If no error occurs, this parameter will be left unmodified. You may specify nil for this parameter, and no error information will be provided.
statement SQL statement to execute.

- (BOOL) beginTransaction  

Begin a transaction. This must provide at least 'Read committed' isolation. As per the SQL standard, the isolation level may be stricter than what has been requested -- this method only gaurantees the MINIMUM of isolation.

For more information on SQL standard transaction isolation levels, refer to PostgreSQL's documentation: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.3/interactive/transaction-iso.html

Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) beginTransactionAndReturnError: (NSError **)  error  

Begin a transaction. This must provide at least 'Read committed' isolation. As per the SQL standard, the isolation level may be stricter than what has been requested -- this method only gaurantees the MINIMUM of isolation.

For more information on SQL standard transaction isolation levels, refer to PostgreSQL's documentation: http://www.postgresql.org/docs/8.3/interactive/transaction-iso.html

Parameters:
error A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the transaction could not be started.
If no error occurs, this parameter will be left unmodified. You may specify nil for this parameter, and no error information will be provided.
Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) commitTransaction  

Commit an open transaction.

Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) commitTransactionAndReturnError: (NSError **)  error  

Commit an open transaction.

Parameters:
error A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the transaction could not be committed.
Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) rollbackTransaction  

Rollback an open transaction.

Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) rollbackTransactionAndReturnError: (NSError **)  error  

Rollback an open transaction.

Parameters:
error A pointer to an NSError object variable. If an error occurs, this pointer will contain an error object indicating why the transaction could not be rolled back.
Returns:
YES on success, NO on failure.

- (BOOL) tableExists: (NSString *)  tableName  

Return YES if the given table name exists.

Returns:
YES if it exists, NO otherwise.
